ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This class provides a wonderful toolkit for nonviolent action.
The various ways to fight for rights
How to analyze social movements: strategy, tactics, mobilizing structures. How the elements of social movements have changed over time, how to build a movement.
Knowledge of social movement history, social movement strategy, and academic literature surrounding social mobiization
The best tactics to make a social movement
I developed a better understanding of social movements and the theory behind them.
protest

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This class was great in that it seemed very practical, however, there was a lot of content we wished to have covered.
I think the course material is very useful and well organized. I hope there could be more group projects on class such as the games we played at the start of the term.

This course honestly does a MUCH better job than I expected. You learn actual strategies and tactics that are applicable to modern organizing and the course builds on each element well to make you feel as though you can design a successful movement.

Strengths: material quality, not a super high workload, interaction with legitimate concepts
Weaknesses: timing of exams (too late midterm), clear communication of class logistics, flexibility
There was a lot of readings that were interesting but didn't end up applying to the content of the course. The class materials were also disorganized.
This course was strong and the material was presented in a comprehensible way.
the tests were unreasonable just wanted memorization

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes!
Yes. It is useful
Absolutely. I found it engaging, challenging, and honestly inspiring.
Yes

Yes, with the caveat of understanding that this course cannot be seen as an 'activism training' and will not alone inform an authentic understanding of current social justice issues or social justice movements.
Yes, I would recommend this course to another student.  If the student has a passion for learning about social movements and their development, this course is a must-take.
no because the grading makes it not enjoyable.  i just memorized facts and didnt focus on learning to get a good grade
